-NKssds8bBZLgFZ7KuRG.description: I LAST MET WITH MY NEIGHBOR ON: 12/14/2022  TELL US ABOUT IT: Didn't go to the home on Sunday, 12/11, due to a schedule conflict. Went today to do lessons with the moms and then after-school lessons with Hasiba and Somaya as usual. Everyone who was sick seems to have recovered and is back to normal.  Ended up not actually doing lessons with the girls. The kids were pretty jazzed up after school and had a hard time settling down. Hameed was there and we chatted for a little bit. He told me that they wanted to give me an Afghani traditional garment for Christmas. Very sweet! Taiba is going to make it, so we talked about colors and then the two of them left for the fabric store and left me there with the kiddos. Since the environment wasn't really conducive to doing lessons at that point, I had them make cards for their teachers. I had brought all the materials with me to do this and had planned to do it after lessons, but we just focused on the cards instead. We'll add the cards to the little gifts I put together for each of the teachers (candy and gift cards), based on a helpful spreadsheet the school PTO put out with each teacher's "favorite things." I brought one sample with me today to show the kids and they thought it was fun. I had originally thought about letting the kids take the gifts and cards to the teachers in their backpacks, but decided the gifts probably wouldn't make it to the teachers since candy tends to disappear pretty fast around here. LOL!! So...I'll stop by the school on Friday during their class parties (and last day of school before their winter break) and give them the gifts then and so I can witness them giving them to the teachers! LOL!!  Since they are on winter break the next two weeks, I'm not planning on doing lessons during that time. Am planning on going next Wednesday for our own little Christmas party and then I will be on vacation the following week.  HOW CAN WE BE PRAYING FOR YOU: Continuing to pray that Jesus will reveal Himself to these families - and all of our refugee families - in a very special way this Christmas season.

She is also training with Christian Friends for this. We then went shopping for groceries and visited.  HOW CAN WE BE PRAYING FOR YOU: Pray for Zakia to become a safe driver so that she can have an easier time with transportation please.  Does this submission look like spam? Report it here.
